DataElement.preferredName: Tissue Microarray Texture Data Field Group Type java.lang.String
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A device for use in high-throughput molecular analysis/screening of clinical tissue specimens.  Tissue microarrays spatially arrange 500-1000 tumor biopsies or other tissue onto a microarray block, which is then sliced into sections for probing DNA, RNA or protein targets to provide coincident analysis of all specimens in the array.  Subsequent sections can be analyzed with additional probes.:A measure of the variation of the intensity of a surface, quantifying properties such as smoothness, coarseness, regularity, and resiliency. The term is often used as a descriptor for the structure or organization of a tissue or organ. The three principal approaches used to describe texture are statistical, structural and spectral.:An area of database record, or graphical user interface form, into which a particular item of data is entered.:Any number of entities (members) considered as a unit._A subdivision of a particular kind of thing._Generic value domain for a java datatype that is a class that represents character strings.

Concepts.definition: A device for use in high-throughput molecular analysis/screening of clinical tissue specimens.  Tissue microarrays spatially arrange 500-1000 tumor biopsies or other tissue onto a microarray block, which is then sliced into sections for probing DNA, RNA or protein targets to provide coincident analysis of all specimens in the array.  Subsequent sections can be analyzed with additional probes.

A measure of the variation of the intensity of a surface, quantifying properties such as smoothness, coarseness, regularity, and resiliency. The term is often used as a descriptor for the structure or organization of a tissue or organ. The three principal approaches used to describe texture are statistical, structural and spectral.
An area of database record, or graphical user interface form, into which a particular item of data is entered.
Any number of entities (members) considered as a unit.

Property.preferredDefinition: A subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
